name: Windosill
description: Explore a dream-like world of impossible wonders... Explore 10 different immersive, animated environments Interact with dozens of physics-based creatures and objects Solve brain-tickling puzzles to unlock new rooms and reveal new...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista Processor: 2 GHz Pentium M or higher Memory: 256 MB Ram Graphics: No special requirements Hard Drive: 8 MB Free space Sound: No special requirements

reviews.review_text: A short beautiful game that is all about playing, and gets even better when it starts playing back. I adored this thing.
I never played it. it's even not exist in my library.  i don't know how the ♥♥♥♥ i can review it...

A very short, very sweet puzzle game with a beautiful art style and a strong sense of whimsy.  Each stage, for lack of a better term, is a single screen. Your task is to interact with and/or manipulate the objects until a white cube appears. Use that cube to open the door, zoom your car along, and head to the next level.  The experience won't last long, but if you enjoy these types of games, you'll grin for the entire 20-30 minutes it lasts.

Windosill is a short, artistic point-and-click interactive art piece. There's no real point exactly, but the scenes and interactions in each provide charm, uniquness and a sense of wonder not found in most similar games. Highly recommended!
Lovely little game. Worth the money.

Such a visually appealing and yet eerie game. I played it from start to finish in one sitting, which means the play time is pretty short, but worth the cost if you're a puzzle game fan. Be sure to play it with the sound up!
Very light-hearted and incredibly quick little puzzle game with some pretty adorable artistics. Definitely worth a buck for roughly 20 minutes worth of accomplishment!

This turned out to be a weird anomaly from an unknown developer that just dropped in out of nowhere. It's hard to find anything to dislike, mostly because it's so brief, and while it's not deep, incredible or revolutionary, it harkens back to those Amanita style games that are content in being merely a short, pleasant experience with minimal gameplay elements, and that's fine by me.   Highlights

Windosill is a small game that allows you to solve puzzles in a relaxing yet otherworldly atmosphere. You play as a toy car that travels through different rooms, each barred by a locked door. Interacting with different object and creatures inhabiting the rooms is the only way to progress. Some of the puzzles can be tricky, and the game is short, but seeing every bizarre room is worth your time. If you enjoyed playing Feed the Head, which is a free game by the same company, you will want to play this game.

As simple as it was, I enjoyed it. Very relaxing puzzle game.  I played it in about half an hour though, so it is very short.  The puzzles were interesting and not too hard or too easy, I would have loved for it to keep going.
Such a lovely game! Nice atmosphere, loved the artwork & sounds (simple but really cute) It is very short but it worths a try. I would play it again while listening to chill step. :)
BEAUTIFUL, highly imaginative game. Absolutely among the best of this nature.  For the ones who loves short games.
The replayability doesn't come from the challenge or even the gameplay, the whimsical surrealist are is enough.
Adorable little puzzle game worth your time.
Piece of art
The game sent me back to my childhood when I was playing around with these things...         YouTube™ Video:  Tiny Love - Karuzela Wyspa Marzeń www.e-mama.pl

Fantastic thinking game. Incredibly short and sweet, leaving me wanting more.  The $2.99RRP price tag might be considered a little over-priced considering the length of the game and quality comparable to many free Flash games - yet worth it, if only for the art style and 'toybox'-like theme.   7 / 10

The oniric travel of a toy vehicle towards finding his own place among the stars. Ten puzzle sceneries constitute its adventure. They are very original, inspiring and beautifully designed. Difficulty is ok, never impossible but sufficient to engage you and amaze you in the end of every puzzle, when the magic mechanics of these worlds suddenly come to light.   Despite the game is a little jewel for what it is, it actually deserved more levels. I recommend it, but take into account that you will not play for more than 40-60 minutes.   7+/10
A very small but very beautiful game. Or maybe a toy.
Super cute. Really liked it fun way to spend half an hour :)
Totally adorable game that I enjoy playing with my 7-year old son. I wish there were more levels to it, it's so ingenious and visually interesting! More please!
Wordcloud review: delight, relaxed, playful, exploring, joy, adorable, Amanita, unique, painterly. If you like it, check out their coming-soon Metamorphabet.
Really cute and interesting. Most of the puzzles aren't too chalenging but they are fun and also very relaxing.

Very short but lovely designed puzzle game. Takes about 20-30 minutes to beat. The levels are interesting but not very logical. Some “puzzles” you can only solve by clicking on different objects until you somehow solve it. It definitely was worth the money for me but if you prefer to get a lot of content for your money you should probably wait until the next sale. Would recommend buying the game for tablets though.

The oniric travel of a toy vehicle towards finding his own place among the stars. Ten puzzle sceneries constitute its adventure. They are very original, inspiring and beautifully designed. Difficulty is ok, never impossible but sufficient to engage you and amaze you in the end of every puzzle, when the magic mechanics of these worlds suddenly come to light.   Despite the game is a little jewel for what it is, it actually deserved more levels. I recommend it, but take into account that you will not play for more than 40-60 minutes.   7+/10

This game made me giggle like a maniac!  It's very short - it took me an hour to finish and I kind of suck at games - but it's extremely cute and utterly charming. Each level centres around finding a small box, using it to open a door, and getting your little toy train character through the door. Playing levels mainly goes like this: 'Ah what a pretty place! Let me just poke some things and see what they do.' 'Heehee that's adorable. <3' 'Okay let's do the puzzle.' 'I don't understand the puzzle!' 'Ah okay that's how you do it. Let's poke some more things!' 'I've poked everything there is to poke. Onwards!'  If you like colourful, fairly simplistic puzzles and enjoy playing with your environment, then you might like this game. It really benefits from not being too fussed about finishing the level in record time or whatever, but being more interested in looking around and enjoying yourself, while incidentally progressing from level to level.
This is the most fun I can have with my pants on in a flash window.

Such a charming little puzzle game, I really enjoyed this. The objective of the game is to journey through the varying landscapes between each door and obtain the cube-shaped key to the next one. The length perfectly suits the beautiful simplicity of the puzzles. Hope the developer produces more games in this style, it's a breath of fresh air. :)
If you don't have it, don't worry about buying it. It's like an expanded desktop widget.  Would make a fun widget...  ...or a browser game.  If you have half an hour to burn then I guess it'll do.
Amazing game... unique and easy to get into... painfully short... but oh so worth playing!
Cute game but very short. After only like a half an hour I finished it.

This is a very odd little puzzle game in a good way. Feels like you are wandering through Salvador Dalis mind and trying to move onto his next thought by solving a puzzle.   Really good fun and extremely original. I know it has been brought out in App store for Apple users and just hope they will bring this out on the windows 8 phone as it would be great fun with a touch screen as i believe it was intended.  For a couple of quid well worth the money, especially if you can get it on a touch pad .
best trippy flash game ever

If you have a kid, or just love the surreal and SMART way of using flash technology at its TOP level, then you absolutely cannot miss this GEM. A linear and fantastic puzzle where you need just some concentration, curiosity and love for testing things around :) Absolutely worth the money.

I highly recommend Windosill for anyone wanting a good logic game. With its child-like nature and mind-boggling puzzles, this game has the best deal, since it's only $3.00. Even though it's a short game, I still liked it a lot.
Great little game. Fairly easy puzzles. I like the concept. Got it in a humble bundle, so nothing to complain about the price. I'd recommend it!
amazing interactive world/story/toy whatever  not sure what to call it and way too short but different and fantastic

a cute little 'game'. more of a tinker trap. I found myself clicking on multiple things many many times, just to hear the sounds and watch the animations again. Overall adorable :D The story itself is cute and simple. Just click on the car, and put a square in the door to start :D Simple, cute, fun, and peaceful  thanks humble bundle

The word to describe this would be 'delightful'. Your goal is to guide a little train to its destination. However, don't become too attached to this goal. There are many things to play with on each screen, and is perfect for unwinding.
A short 'n' sweet point 'n' click puzzler with lovely vector graphics! Thumbs up.
A funny little game, perhaps not that long but very fun. Especially with the Winter sale, I can definately recommend it!
Had to uninstall this because it is such a good procrastination tool.
One of those games that's so good, I wish I could take credit for it.
A short but fantastically quirky little game that squeezes you to think about object interaction.

No idea why this game is so great? Well here are the reasons.  -You get to form a relationship with a little car! -You get to take your new car-friend through puzzles! -End it with a strangely emotional outro! -Fight 3 monsters whom are very annoying! -Basically just form a very good relationship with a car!
A delightful half-hour puzzle.

It's cute. It's really really cute.  And neat, And like, ya know, that sorta stuff. Not immensly difficult, or long, but holds it's own. Though, I would suggest buying it on sale, because full price....not that worth it.   But cute..
it's like a half an hour long
Really fun, and calm game. Just find a cube, and go to the next door. Its getting harder, but its really easy to get cubes.  Not bad, but i love it! <3

Such a charming little puzzle game, I really enjoyed this. The objective of the game is to journey through the varying landscapes between each door and obtain the cube-shaped key to the next one. The length perfectly suits the beautiful simplicity of the puzzles. Hope the developer produces more games in this style, it's a breath of fresh air. :)

Beautiful and unique. It doesn't take long to complete, but you have never played anything like this before - guaranteed. I can really recommend it, even though you are done with it after 30 minutes. I play it once in a while again, though. So for what it is, I am really going to give it a 10/10. It's unique and fun and a nice calming game. Those 10/10 are of course not comparable with a not-puzzle game, of course.
Very short but entertaining.
I loved it, it felt like playing with toys. The sound design and aesthetics were great. Good for adults and children. I played it with a friend and we enjoyed it.
A wonderful game to pass the time. The puzzles are creative and the price is great. If you're interesting in a good short puzzle game, this is perfect.

Received this as part of a Humble Bundle deal and from a gaming perspective this would be best experienced on a tablet, something you can download once you have activated your key. The game itself is quite short, beat all 11 'levels' in about 25 minutes, but it is visually appealing and there is something about exploring and tinkering with the rooms that is really pleasing/rewarding.  As a note, you can play the first half of this game for free on the windosill website and determine if it is worth a purchase or not. For full disclosure, not sure I would purchase stand alone for more than a couple of dollars but within the bundle I received it is a nice addition!

WindoSill is a short and fun game that is colorful and quick to play. It basically is just to see what animations can be done solve the room puzzles, but this game is very short!   For the price though, its cute and fun, but only one play through is needed and not much to do.
Very short, sometimes illogical or the gameplay literally involves clicking lots of time. That's it. No replayability either. Still, it is very very cheap but there's a reason for that.
I don't get the sense of the game. This game is played through in 5 Minutes and is for 4 year olds only.
Once a free flash game, now available for money... click stuff to open a door to click some more stuff. Has a certain appeal and charme but no... it's a flash game dude, why pay for it??
The puzzles in this game don't really make any sense, barely a puzzle game.
